contents.text:
Network Working Group                                         R. Hinden
Request for Comments: 2375                             Ipsilon Networks
Category: Informational                                      S. Deering
                                                                  Cisco
                                                              July 1998
This memo provides information for the Internet community. It does not specify an Internet standard of any kind. Distribution of this memo is unlimited.
contents.zh-CHS: 本备忘录为互联网社区提供信息。它没有规定任何类型的互联网标准。本备忘录的分发不受限制。

contents.text: Copyright (C) The Internet Society (1998). All Rights Reserved.
contents.zh-CHS: 版权所有（C）互联网协会（1998年）。版权所有。

contents.text: This document defines the initial assignment of IPv6 multicast addresses. It is based on the "IP Version 6 Addressing Architecture" [ADDARCH] and current IPv4 multicast address assignment found in <ftp://venera.isi.edu/in-notes/iana/assignments/multicast-addresses>. It adapts the IPv4 assignments that are relevant to IPv6 assignments. IPv4 assignments that were not relevant were not converted into IPv6 assignments. Comments are solicited on this conversion.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档定义了IPv6多播地址的初始分配。它基于“IP版本6寻址体系结构”[ADDARCH]和中的当前IPv4多播地址分配<ftp://venera.isi.edu/in-notes/iana/assignments/multicast-addresses>. 它调整与IPv6分配相关的IPv4分配。不相关的IPv4分配未转换为IPv6分配。征求对这一转换的意见。

contents.text: All other IPv6 multicast addresses are reserved.
contents.zh-CHS: 保留所有其他IPv6多播地址。

contents.text: Sections 2 and 3 specify reserved and preassigned IPv6 multicast addresses.
contents.zh-CHS: 第2节和第3节规定了保留和预分配的IPv6多播地址。

contents.text: [ADDRARCH] defines rules for assigning new IPv6 multicast addresses.
contents.zh-CHS: [ADDRARCH]定义分配新IPv6多播地址的规则。

contents.text: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in [RFC 2119].
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件中的关键词“必须”、“不得”、“要求”、“应”、“不应”、“应”、“不应”、“建议”、“可”和“可选”应按照[RFC 2119]中所述进行解释。

contents.text: These permanently assigned multicast addresses are valid over a specified scope value.
contents.zh-CHS: 这些永久分配的多播地址在指定的作用域值上有效。

contents.text:
FF01:0:0:0:0:0:0:1     All Nodes Address                  [ADDARCH]
FF01:0:0:0:0:0:0:2     All Routers Address                [ADDARCH]

FF02:0:0:0:0:0:0:1     All Nodes Address                  [ADDARCH]
FF02:0:0:0:0:0:0:2     All Routers Address                [ADDARCH]
FF02:0:0:0:0:0:0:3     Unassigned                             [JBP]
FF02:0:0:0:0:0:0:4     DVMRP Routers                  [RFC1075,JBP]
FF02:0:0:0:0:0:0:5     OSPFIGP                        [RFC2328,Moy]
FF02:0:0:0:0:0:0:6     OSPFIGP Designated Routers     [RFC2328,Moy]
FF02:0:0:0:0:0:0:7     ST Routers                    [RFC1190,KS14]
FF02:0:0:0:0:0:0:8     ST Hosts                      [RFC1190,KS14]
FF02:0:0:0:0:0:0:9     RIP Routers                        [RFC2080]
FF02:0:0:0:0:0:0:A     EIGRP Routers                    [Farinacci]
FF02:0:0:0:0:0:0:B     Mobile-Agents                 [Bill Simpson]

FF02:0:0:0:0:0:0:D     All PIM Routers                  [Farinacci]
FF02:0:0:0:0:0:0:E     RSVP-ENCAPSULATION                  [Braden]

FF05:0:0:0:0:0:1:3       All-dhcp-servers           [Bound,Perkins]
FF05:0:0:0:0:0:1:4       All-dhcp-relays            [Bound,Perkins]
FF05:0:0:0:0:0:1:1000    Service Location                 [RFC2165]
 -FF05:0:0:0:0:0:1:13FF
These permanently assigned multicast addresses are valid over all scope ranges. This is shown by an "X" in the scope field of the address that means any legal scope value.
contents.zh-CHS: 这些永久分配的多播地址在所有作用域范围内都有效。地址范围字段中的“X”表示任何合法范围值。

contents.text: Note that, as defined in [ADDARCH], IPv6 multicast addresses which are only different in scope represent different groups. Nodes must join each group individually.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，正如[ADDARCH]中所定义的，范围不同的IPv6多播地址代表不同的组。节点必须单独加入每个组。

contents.text: The IPv6 multicast addresses with variable scope are as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 具有可变作用域的IPv6多播地址如下所示：

contents.text:

FF0X:0:0:0:0:0:2:0000

[ADDARCH] Hinden, R., and S. Deering, "IP Version 6 Addressing Architecture", RFC 2373, July 1998.
[AUTORFC] Thompson, S., and T. Narten, "IPv6 Stateless Address Autoconfiguration", RFC 1971, August 1996.
contents.zh-CHS: [AUTORFC]Thompson，S.和T.Narten，“IPv6无状态地址自动配置”，RFC 1971年，1996年8月。

contents.text: [ETHER] Crawford, M., "Transmission of IPv6 Packets over Ethernet Networks", Work in Progress.
contents.zh-CHS: [ETHER]Crawford，M.，“通过以太网传输IPv6数据包”，正在进行中。

contents.text: [RFC1045] Cheriton, D., "VMTP: Versatile Message Transaction Protocol Specification", RFC 1045, February 1988.
contents.zh-CHS: [RFC1045]Cheriton，D.，“VMTP：通用消息事务协议规范”，RFC 10451988年2月。

contents.text: [RFC1075] Waitzman, D., Partridge, C., and S. Deering, "Distance Vector Multicast Routing Protocol", RFC 1075, November 1988.
contents.zh-CHS: [RFC1075]Waitzman，D.，Partridge，C.，和S.Deering，“距离向量多播路由协议”，RFC 1075，1988年11月。

contents.text: [RFC1112] Deering, S., "Host Extensions for IP Multicasting", STD 5, RFC 1112, Stanford University, August 1989.
contents.zh-CHS: [RFC1112]Deering，S.，“IP多播的主机扩展”，STD 5，RFC 1112，斯坦福大学，1989年8月。

contents.text: [RFC1119] Mills, D., "Network Time Protocol (Version 1), Specification and Implementation", STD 12, RFC 1119, July 1988.
contents.zh-CHS: [RFC1119]Mills，D.，“网络时间协议（第1版），规范和实施”，STD 12，RFC 1119，1988年7月。

contents.text: [RFC2080] Malkin, G., and R. Minnear, "RIPng for IPv6", RFC 2080, January 1997.
[RFC2119] Bradner, S., "Key words for use in RFCs to Indicate Requirement Levels", BCP 14, RFC 2119, March 1997.

[RFC2328] Moy, J., "OSPF Version 2", STD 54, RFC 2328, April 1998.

contents.zh-CHS: [布雷斯勒]大卫·J·布雷斯勒<bressler@tss.com>，1996年4月。
[维扎德斯]约翰·维扎德斯<veizades@tgv.com>，1995年5月。

contents.text: This document defines the initial assignment of IPv6 multicast addresses. As such it does not directly impact the security of the Internet infrastructure or its applications.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档定义了IPv6多播地址的初始分配。因此，它不会直接影响互联网基础设施或其应用程序的安全。
